Comment: The number of post on here that have no clue what is really happening is crazy. Do some real research. No one is deporting a 2 year old US citizen. That statement is a 100% lie and when you do the real research you will find it is just news organizations baiting people with it.  The truth is the mother is being deported not the child. The mother wants the child to go back with her so they agreed to allow it instead of taking away her child. The father tried to come pick up the child but the mother refused to allow the child to go with him (the father and mother are not currently married or together which brings up the question of why? maybe he was abusive and she didn't want him to have the kid?) The DEA asked for the father to provide proof that he was the father and if he was then there would be a custody case before she was allowed to go back with the child. As of this posting the father has still refused to give any proof that he is really the father so the child will go back with the mother.  I don't know if you know but a birth certificate would have the father's name on it if he was around when the child was born. He could get it and show proof he is the father but maybe he wasn't around when the child was born and his name isn't on it. If his name is missing from the birth certificate he could ask for a DNA test to prove he is the father but for some reason his lawyer has not told him this information or he doesn't want to do it because the DNA could maybe link him to a crime.  The other 2 children the father I guess had at the same and the father gave custody to 2 other relatives which also may mean he doesn't want to prove he is the father because he is also here illegally. Why would the father give away his rights on the other 2 children if he is a legal US citizen? Something makes no sense here.  TLDR: There is no 2-year-old US citizen being deported but it is being sent back with the mother who is being deported. Sounds like a custody dispute between a mother who is being deported and a father who may or may not be a legal US citizen and doesn't want to get deported.

Comment: “The unborn” are a convenient group of people to advocate for. They never make demands of you; they are morally uncomplicated, unlike the incarcerated, addicted, or the chronically poor; they don’t resent your condescension or complain that you are not politically correct; unlike widows, they don’t ask you to question patriarchy; unlike orphans, they don’t need money, education, or childcare; unlike aliens, they don’t bring all that racial, cultural, and religious baggage that you dislike; they allow you to feel good about yourself without any work at creating or maintaining relationships; and when they are born, you can forget about them, because they cease to be unborn. You can love the unborn and advocate for them without substantially challenging your own wealth, power, or privilege, without re-imagining social structures, apologizing, or making reparations to anyone. They are, in short, the perfect people to love if you want to claim you love Jesus, but actually dislike people who breathe. Prisoners? Immigrants? The sick? The poor? Widows? Orphans? All the groups that are specifically mentioned in the Bible? They all get thrown under the bus for the unborn.”  ― Methodist Pastor David Barnhart

Comment: I’ve been in a domestic partnership for many years. We always wanted to marry, but never got around to it. Lower middle class, always some shit coming up, you know how it is. Then the tax codes changed and it would actually be disadvantageous.   When we met we were young and wild and never thought about having children. Now we’re older and the biological clock is ticking, and we would love to at least have the option. Those thoughts are starting to creep into our heads-   “Hey, they’d be cute, wouldn’t they? We’d be able to teach them so much stuff, wouldn’t we? Who would they look like more?   “We’ll have family when we’re old. We won’t be alone”  That last sentence- that’s when I realize how selfish I am being. That thought occupies my mind more than I’d like to admit: I’m growing older, and I’d like to procreate because I don’t want to be alone when I die.   Bringing a child into this world for THAT is beyond bullshit. Let me die in a puddle alone.
